resources.string: Cannot show current location without permission
Please enable location in system settings
Select a base map for offline use
No imagery downloaded for offline use. Tap “Select and download” to get started.
Drag the map and tap “Add point“ to add points to your polygon. To finish, return to the original point and tap “Complete“.
Once opened, surveys are available offline and synced automatically when online.
Your data will be synced shortly.
Add new site and submit related data
Drag your map until the center pin is on the desired location
This job has no more tasks to complete
This survey is misconfigured (no data sharing terms available). Please contact the survey organizer.
Can’t collect data as user is a VIEWER
No imagery for this area. Select an area with imagery to download to your device.
The selected area may take up to %s\u00A0MB of space on your device
Zoom in and select a smaller area to download to your device
Icon shown when the survey is available offline
No surveys available. Contact your survey organizer to get access.
Connect to the internet to sign in
You need to grant this application camera permissions to submit photos.
Move the map and tap “Add point” to add points around the desired area.
If you sign out, any unsynced data will be discarded
Zoom in to start collecting data
Zoom in to a data collection site to collect data
A new data collection site will be created.

Ground is an open-source community project built by Google and FAO under the Forest Data Partnership with help from SIG, Ecam, and open-source community contributors. 

It is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0. 

View other Licenses
If you sign out, all unsaved data will be lost.
To continue, contact your system administrator to request access.
To continue, sign up to request access.
Report technical issues or suggest new locationsOfInterest
## Private data sharing \nData will only be shared with survey organizers, who may not share and use collected data publicly.

## Public data sharing 
Survey organizers may share and use data publicly under the *Creative Commons CC0 1.0 License*:
